metadata.title: CVE-2011-3208 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Stack-based buffer overflow in the split_wildmats function in nntpd.c innntpd in Cyrus IMAP Server before 2.3.17 and 2.4.x before 2.4.11 allowsremote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted NNTP command.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-3208` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cyrus-admin - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-admin-2.2 - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-admin-2.4 - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-clients - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-clients-2.2 - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-clients-2.4 - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-common - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-common-2.2 - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-common-2.4 - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-imapd - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-imapd-2.2 - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-imapd-2.4 - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-murder - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-murder-2.2 - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-murder-2.4 - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-nntpd - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-nntpd-2.2 - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-nntpd-2.4 - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-pop3d - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-pop3d-2.2 - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-pop3d-2.4 - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-replication - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-replication-2.4 - 2.4.16-1
libcyrus-imap-perl - 2.4.16-1
libcyrus-imap-perl22 - 2.4.16-1
libcyrus-imap-perl24 - 2.4.16-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cyrus-imapd-2.4 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.16-1').
